benchmark_details.name: IntentGrasp
benchmark_details.overview: IntentGrasp is a benchmark supporting multi-target grasping under flexible instructions, allowing for the assessment of robotic systems in understanding indirect verbal commands and grasping multiple objects in a 3D environment.
benchmark_details.data_type: 3D point clouds with object annotations and grasp poses

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate robotic grasping capabilities under flexible instructions and enrich the existing benchmarks for multi-object grasp detection.

data.source: Adapted from the Grasp-Anything-6D dataset with structured prompt templates for flexible instruction generation.
data.size: 1 million scenes with approximately 3 million objects
data.annotation: Automatically generated using a large language model for contextual instructions.

methods: Joint training with visual and textual modalities
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the alignment of predicted grasp poses with ground-truth annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher coverage rates indicate better performance in accurately grasping objects as per flexible instructions.
methodology.baseline_results: GraspCoT outperformed baseline models like 3DAPNet and LGrasp6D in all metrics on the IntentGrasp benchmark.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were conducted in both simulated and real-world settings.

harm: Potential safety hazards due to failure in grasp detection leading to drops or collisions.
